forkCompact.title: Fork Compact Configuration
forkCompact.description: Configure the model and prompt used when creating compact conversation summaries. Fork Compact creates a new conversation with a summary of the current conversation history.
forkCompact.modelHelp: Leave empty to use the same model as the current conversation. Select a specific model to always use that model for compact summaries.
forkCompact.promptPlaceholder: Enter the prompt for generating compact summaries...
forkCompact.promptHelp: This prompt will be sent to the AI along with the conversation history to generate a compact summary. The summary will become the first assistant message in the new forked conversation.
forkCompact.resetConfirm: Reset Fork Compact settings to defaults?
forkCompact.resetSuccess: Fork Compact settings reset to defaults

parameters.description: Set the default global values for AI parameters. These can be overridden per-project or per-prompt turn.

prompt.title: Global System Prompt
prompt.description: Default instructions for the assistant. Can be overridden per-project.
prompt.placeholder: Enter default system instructions for the assistant...
prompt.updateError: Failed to update prompt. Please try again.

titles.modelDescription: Choose which model to use for generating conversation titles. Uses global default model if not specified.
titles.contentLengthDescription: Maximum characters from conversation to include in title generation prompt (100-4000).
titles.includeFiles: Include file context in title prompt
titles.includeRules: Include active rules in title prompt

tools.maxStepsDescription: Limits the number of sequential tool calls the AI can make before generating a final response (1-20). Higher values allow more complex tasks but increase latency and cost. (Default: 5)

followUp.title: Follow-up Templates
followUp.description: Select templates that can be suggested as follow-ups after this template is used.
followUp.selectTemplate: Select a template to add as follow-up
followUp.noTemplatesAvailable: No templates available for follow-ups. Create more templates first.
followUp.allTemplatesSelected: All available templates have been selected as follow-ups.

bridge.configDescription: Configure where LiteChat looks for the dynamic MCP bridge service (required for stdio:// servers). Start the bridge with: npm run mcp-proxy
bridge.locationDescription: Specify where your dynamic MCP bridge is running (default: localhost:3001)
bridge.fullUrlDescription: Complete URL where the dynamic MCP bridge is running
bridge.hostPortDescription: Host and port (uses HTTP by default)
bridge.priorityNote: Leave empty for auto-detection. For remote bridge, use full URL or configure host binding.
bridge.instructionsText: To use stdio MCP servers, install and run the bridge:
bridge.startBridge: Start the bridge (from LiteChat project directory)

server.urlHelp: HTTP/HTTPS URLs for remote servers, or stdio://command?args=arg1,arg2 for dynamic bridge servers
server.descriptionPlaceholder: Brief description of this server's purpose
server.headersHelp: JSON object with authentication headers (not applicable for stdio servers)
server.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this MCP server?
